name: Students and Families Experiencing Homelessness
description: This program helps schools support students who qualify under the federal McKinney-Vento Homeless Assistance ACT. SAFEH works to assist students experiencing housing transition, instability, and homelessness to enroll in school, attend regularly and succeed academically.
fullDescription: This program helps schools support students who qualify under the federal McKinney-Vento Homeless Assistance ACT. SAFEH works to assist students experiencing housing transition, instability, and homelessness to enroll in school, attend regularly and succeed academically.
whatTheyOffer: This program helps schools support students who qualify under the federal McKinney-Vento Homeless Assistance ACT. SAFEH works to assist students experiencing housing transition, instability, and homelessness to enroll in school, attend regularly and succeed academically.
howToGetIt: Send email to safeh@sfusd.edu ELIGIBILITY: Students who are: Temporarily living in a motel, hotel or single-room occupancy (SRO) due to loss of housing, economic hardship, natural disaster, or similar reason Temporarily living with another family(s) due to loss of housing, economic hardship, natural disaster, lack of adequate housing, or similar reason (aka “doubled-up” or “tripled up”) Living in a car, park, trailer park, campground, abandoned building, on the streets, or other inadequate accommodations (i.e., lack of water, electricity, or heat) In a shelter (family, domestic violence, youth shelter, or transitional living program) With friends or family because they run away or are an unaccompanied youth
